precontext: Tom was eager to blend in at the comedy show. He settled into one of the middle rows of the theater, trying not to draw attention. The large venue was buzzing with anticipation as people took their seats.
sentence: The guy in the crowd appeared to be next to a plant.
meanings_considered: an actor situated in the audience whose acting is rehearsed but seems spontaneous to the audience
(botany) a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
explanation:
• The precontext describes a comedy show setting, where audience members are present, making the "actor in the audience" meaning highly plausible.  
• The phrase "next to a plant" in a theater context is more naturally interpreted as a botanical plant in a garden or setting, but the context does not mention a garden or outdoor environment.  
• The mention of "the guy in the crowd" and "next to a plant" suggests a physical object or person, and "plant" as a person (a performer) fits better with the theatrical setting than a botanical one.
